p: For the case of the modeling of breeding distribution, an area of 435,640 km 2 is projected ( Table 4). Regarding the projections of climate change for 2100, under the moderate scenario of 2.6 rcp an increase (8.77%) in pelican breeding distribution is predicted ( Table 4). Under the severe scenario of 8.5 rcp, a decrease (âˆ’19.30%) in pelican breeding distribution is predicted ( Table 4). Under the severe scenario, the model predicts a decrease of occurrence probability of nesting sites of the pelican in northern Ecuador and north-central Chile ( Fig. 2).
